The results are based on the final answer key, released after reviewing candidate objections.

description: A brutal animal sacrifice involving around 50 goats, killed by biting their throats, has been reported from Jagtial district during the Bheemanna Jatara. Animal rights activists recorded the disturbing ritual, leading to an FIR against organizers under multiple acts. Despite being illegal, such sacrifices persist, with locals citing tradition and belief in wish fulfillment.

description: A 32-hour traffic jam on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, caused by a gas tanker accident, left thousands stranded. Industrialist Dr. Sudhir Mehta, stuck for eight hours, resorted to a helicopter to return to Pune. He highlighted the need for emergency helipads and criticized the deteriorating condition of the highway, calling it a dangerous gamble.

Delhi Capitals, led by Jemimah Rodrigues, aims for their first championship after three runner-up finishes. Both teams have seen key player contributions throughout the season.

description: A tanker carrying flammable propylene overturned on the Pune-Mumbai expressway, causing a 32-hour traffic disruption. Thousands of commuters, including patients and senior citizens, faced a harrowing ordeal with no food or water. Rescue operations and gas transfer caused significant delays, impacting transport services.

description: The playschool has been opened at Shaheed Suresh Singh Government Senior Secondary School in Lambi-Sahad, under Lambi-Ahir village panchayat, with transportation facility and inclusive access

title: Man kicked, punched, beaten in Delhi for objecting to harassment of women
description: A 26-year-old businessman was brutally assaulted in south Delhi's Mehrauli after he intervened to stop four men from harassing three women. The attackers beat him severely, even after he lost consciousness. Police have arrested all four accused, who have been charged under various sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Energy security of 1.4bn Indians govt’s supreme priority: Goyal in Parliament
description: ​​On choice of oil suppliers, Piyush Goyal said “Diversifying our energy sourcing in keeping with objective market conditions and evolving international dynamics is at the core of our strategy to ensure this. All of India’s actions are taken with this in mind.” The remark stood out against the backdrop of US President Donald Trump’s claims that India had decided to stop the purchase of Russian oil to secure a trade deal.

title: BATC 2026: Indian men, women register contrasting wins to seal quarterfinal spots

description: The Detroit Red Wings have established themselves as major trade contenders before the NHL trade freeze, while Darren Dreger links them to Calgary Flames veterans MacKenzie Weegar and Nazem Kadri. The Detroit Red Wings target players who have remaining contract time because they possess enough salary cap space and prospect assets to execute a major trade deal while pursuing playoff success.

The ambitious plan aims to secure the superstars without sacrificing key players like Bam Adebayo and Norman Powell.  This potential blockbuster trade, if successful, would significantly reshape the league's landscape.

title: 'During COVID, she kicked me out of the house’: R Madhavan on how Sarita pushed him back to work
description: R Madhavan recently shared a candid and humorous anecdote about how his wife Sarita played a key role in pushing him back into work during the pandemic. What began as a light-hearted nudge eventually became a turning point, helping the actor reassess his mindset, reset after a four-year break from acting, and return with renewed focus—especially towards projects that genuinely excited him, including a steady shift to OTT platforms.

Drunk techie strips naked outside Bangalore Club, blocks car, fights cops
description: A US-based techie, Rajesh Anant, was denied entry to the Bangalore Club for being unaccompanied and inebriated. He later returned naked, blocked a car, and fought with security and police, leading to his father's one-month club suspension and his own ban.

title: Belagavi court sentences 12 people to 5 years in prison for stripping and parading Dalit woman
Vivek Oberoi moves to court for protection of his personality rights
description: Actor Vivek Oberoi has filed a lawsuit in the Delhi High Court seeking legal protection for his personality rights against unauthorized use of his name, image, and voice across digital platforms. The plea aims to prevent impersonation, the sale of unlicensed merchandise, and the creation of AI-generated content, including deepfakes, that exploit his identity.

title: Birthday balloons explode inside lift in Mumbai’s Goregaon
description: A young student, Himani Tapriya, sustained severe burns after dozens of gas-filled balloons exploded in a lift at Amol Tower, Goregaon. The incident occurred when a delivery man, Raju Kumar Mahato, entered the lift with the balloons. Police have registered a negligence case against the shop owner for failing to provide safety instructions to his employee, who also suffered injuries.

title: 'Had to leave my marriage': Melinda hints at Bill Gates’ Epstein link as reason for divorce
description: Melinda French Gates expressed deep sadness and exhaustion over newly released Epstein files that resurfaced painful memories from her marriage to Bill Gates. She emphasized her heartbreak for the victims and stated that her ex-husband and others involved need to answer for their actions, not her.

title: India-US trade deal: What it means for economy, markets & Russian oil imports?
description: India and the US have announced a framework for a bilateral trade deal to strengthen trade ties, under which the US will cut tariffs on Indian goods to 18% from 50%. The Centre has clarified that agriculture and dairy remain protected, while sectors such as textiles, leather and gems may benefit.

title: Sikkal Singaravelan
Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
description: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.
